intro: Psychotria leiocarpa var. elliptica, commonly known as the elliptic psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its elliptical leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in understory vegetation of humid forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
